ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.3_0: After robing up one morning, he took his bowl and robe and went to a certain family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.4_0: Just then the housewife was sitting at the entrance door and the daughter-in-law at the door to one of the rooms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.5_0: Udāyī went up to the housewife and gave her a teaching, whispering in her ear.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.7_0: “Is this ascetic my daughter-in-law or is he speaking indecently?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.8_0: Udāyī gave her a teaching in the same way.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.8_1: and after going, he taught the Dhamma to her Full-Moon day.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.10_0: “Is this ascetic my daughter-in-law’s lover, or is he speaking indecently?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.11_0: After teaching the household life, he left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.12_0: Then the housewife said to her daughter-in-law,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.13_0: “Hey, what did that ascetic say to you?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.15_0: But what did he say to you?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.17_0: And they complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.18_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī give teachings by whispering in the ear?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.19_0: Should not teachings be given audibly and openly?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.20_0: The monks heard the complaints of those women,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.21_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.22_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī give teachings to women?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.23_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.24_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.27_0: How can you give a teaching to a woman?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.28_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.29_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.30.1_0: ‘If a monk gives a teaching to a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:1.31_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.1_0: Soon afterwards some female lay followers saw some monks and said to them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.3_0: “It’s not allowable for us to teach women.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.4_0: “Please just teach five or six sentences. Even with that much it’s possible to understand the Teaching.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.5_0: “It’s not allowable for us to teach women.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.6_0: And being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not teach them.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.7_0: Then those female lay followers complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.8_0: “How can the venerables not give teachings to us?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.9_0: The monks heard the complaints of those female lay followers,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.11_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.12_0: “Monks, I allow you to teach five or six sentences to a woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.13_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.14.1_0: ‘If a monk gives a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:2.15_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.1_0: When the monks from the group of six knew that the Buddha had made this allowance, they taught women more than five or six sentences in the presence of a man who did not understand.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.3_0: “How can the monks from the group of six give teachings to women more than five or six sentences in the presence of a man who doesn’t understand?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.4_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.8_0: “... Foolish men, how can you teach women more than five or six sentences in the presence of a man who doesn’t understand?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.10_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:3.11.1_0: ‘If a monk gives a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.6_1: a spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.6_2: She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.7_0: They stand more than six sentences:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.8_0: in excess of five or six sentences.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.10_0: what has been spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by sages, what has been spoken by gods, what is connected with what is beneficial, what is connected with the Teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.12_0: if he teaches by the line, then for every line he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.13_0: If he teaches by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.14_0: Except in the presence of a man who understands:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.15_0: unless a man who understands is present.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.1.17_0: one who is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is indecent and what is decent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.1_0: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he teaches her more than five or six sentences, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.2_0: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he teaches her more than five or six sentences, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.3_0: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he teaches her more than five or six sentences, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.4_0: If he teaches more than five or six sentences to a female spirit, a female ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a female animal in the form of a woman, except in the presence of a man who understands, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.5_0: If it is not a woman, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.6_0: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.2.7_0: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.2_0: if a man who understands is present;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.3_0: if he teaches five or six sentences;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.4_0: if he teaches less than five or six sentences;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.5_0: if he gets up and then sits down again and teaches;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.6_0: if the woman gets up and then sits down again, and he then teaches her;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.9_0: if he replies when asked a question;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.10_0: if he is speaking for the benefit of someone else and a woman listens in;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.12_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc7:4.3.13_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on teaching, is finished.
